intro: Krebsia capnitidis, commonly known as the common wood sorrel, is a flowering plant in the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant is native to various regions in Europe, Asia, and Africa, often found in woodland and grassland habitats. Krebsia capnitidis typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural and disturbed areas.
